questions.question: Beware of that ……………………….. in sheep’s clothing.
questions.description: A wolf in sheep’s clothing is a hypocrite.

questions.question: After her husband’s death, she is struggling to keep the ……………………………….. from the door.
questions.description: To keep the wolf from the door is to avert starvation.

questions.question: The violence came to a ……………………….. when the police fired at the rioters.
questions.description: To come to a head is to reach a crisis.

questions.question: He might plead the cause of the poor, but he is unlikely to put his hand in his ..........................................
questions.description: To put your hand in your pocket is to donate money to a charity.

questions.question: You see she has two strings to her ……………………………. She is a writer. She also does modeling.
questions.description: To have two strings to your bow is to have two sources of income.

questions.question: They have threatened war to the …………………………….. if their demands are not granted.
questions.description: A war to the knife is a deadly struggle.

questions.question: He joined the company as a cashier but now he is at the top of the …………………………..
questions.description: When you are at the top of the tree you are at the highest position in an organization.

questions.question: I sent him about his …………………………… because I could no longer stand his insolence.
questions.description: To send somebody about their business is to dismiss them rudely.

questions.question: He says that he has rubbed …………………………… with many celebrities.
questions.description: To rub shoulders with somebody is to be in close contact with them.

questions.question: I have told you time and again not to poke your …………………………… into my business.
questions.description: To poke your nose is to meddle in another person’s affairs.

questions.question: He is the ……………………………. man of his boss.
questions.description: The right hand man is the person who supports you the most.

questions.question: After the death of his parents, his uncle took him under his …………………………….
questions.description: To take somebody under your wing is to offer them protection.
